title: Multiple Deployment Options
longDescription: The Delivery Pipeline automates the continuous deployment of the Fibonacci services to Cloud Foundry, OpenWhisk and Kubernetes.

deploy-bluemix-api-key.description: Bluemix API key (Obtain one using 'bx iam api-key-create my-new-key')

deploy-cluster-name.description: Existing Kubernetes cluster name (if empty, the toolchain will not deploy the service to Kubernetes)

deploy-image-name.description: Fibonnaci service Docker image. Obtain the Docker namespace using 'bx cr namespace-list'.

container-space.description: Name of the space configured for IBM Container Service

items.title: The toolchain will deploy the Fibonacci service as a Cloud Foundry application with a random route and as an OpenWhisk action. The action will also be exposed as an HTTP endpoint. Specify the space where the application and the action will be deployed.

To build the Fibonacci service Docker image with the toolchain, specify a Bluemix space configured with quota for IBM Containers. If you have no space configured with IBM Containers quota, leave the default options. In that case, you will need to build and push the Docker image outside of this toolchain.
Specify the name of an existing cluster where to deploy the Fibonacci service. The Bluemix API key is used to access the IBM Container Service API and interact with the cluster.
